heading: HTML
description: HTML code ensures the proper formatting of text and images for your Internet browser, while also providing a basic structure of the page, upon which Cascading Style Sheets are overlaid to change its appearance.

heading: CSS
description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document. CSS is designed to enable the separation of presentation and content, including layout, colors, and fonts.

heading: JavaScript
description: JavaScript enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications. The vast majority of websites use it for client-side page behavior, and most browsers have a dedicated JavaScript engine to execute.

heading: Node JS
description: An open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a web browser. Node.js lets developers use JavaScript to write command line tools and pretty much have a great time.

heading: React
description: React was created as a Javascript Library and is now one of the most popular frameworks in web development.  Users can make interactive UI's easily as well as develop new features while keeping your existing code.

heading: Databases
description: A database is an organized collection of data, generally stored and accessed electronically from a computer system. Database systems are an essential tool in our society and can be found in libraries, schools and websites
